comments.body:
@mzelesky suggested to add in bibdata the `homoit_s` so that we indicate in the record page the source of the term. previous example for lcgft_s https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/pull/471/files. 
@mzelesky suggested to revisit https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/pull/3029 as part of this work.

bibdata.title: Figgy ARKs resolving to Voyager IDs instead of Alma IDs

comments.body: the rake task to generate the figgy_ark_cache errors. The figgy ark cache that is used still has the voyager ids. As a result we build the domain catalog url with the voyager id.  This url is included in the electronic_access_1display field and is used in the Available Online section to display the Digital content  or Selected images text anchor with this link. The issue is that when the user will click on the link it will not navigate them down to the viewer but it will render a new webpage to resolve the voyager id to the current Alma id.

bibdata.title: Ruby 2.7 raises warning URI.unescape, URI.escape is obsolete
CDL Record Does Not Show "View Digital Content" Link

comments.body:
The availability we get for this record is:
{
"99101599253506421": {
"engineer$res": {
"on_reserve": "Y",
"location": "engineer$res",
"label": "Engineering Library - Reserve",
"status_label": "Available",
"copy_number": null,
"cdl": false,
"temp_location": true,
"id": "engineer$res"
},
"lewis$res": {
"on_reserve": "Y",
"location": "lewis$res",
"label": "Lewis Library - Course Reserve",
"status_label": "Unavailable",
"copy_number": null,
"cdl": false,
"temp_location": true,
"id": "lewis$res"
}
}
}

cdl is false. Then https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/c017e0c6486aaaaf860a2cf0d6a1a9fd8d256974/app/javascript/orangelight/availability.es6#L204 will not insert the online link. 
We may want to confirm first that the 'cdl': false we return from bibdata is correct.
check if the issue is related to the fact that the cdl item is in a temporary location.

dls-handbook.title: Update page titles to improve sidebar TOC sorting, reorder some readme links

figgy.title: Select for Ephemera Folder Subject Select on Edit scrolls to the bottom

comments.body:
We messed with this for a while but weren't able to a good fix. Some considerations and things we tried:

- The nested options are a local enhancement.
- The "open" event appears to run the focus reset code after it executes, so when we tried to attach an event to it sending the focus back to the top, it didn't take.
- We couldn't access the Result prototype in order to override the `ensureHighlightVisible` function.
- After reading about adapters (e.g. https://select2.org/advanced/default-adapters/results) we tried an approach similar to https://github.com/select2/select2/issues/4436#issuecomment-227692224 by running the following in the browser console but it didn't work. Perhaps we would need to bring in the code via a javascript bundler rather than a CDN to make this kind of change: 

```
$.fn.select2.amd.require(['select2/results'], function (Result) {
    Result.prototype.ensureHighlightVisible = function () { }
})
```

We've decided to close this issue for now since we've spent a lot of time on it without yet knowing the bug's impact on users.
https://figgy.princeton.edu/cdl/92260856-c74d-4e7c-bf95-725ce1b2de1a/status is returning a 404, but in the console it's fine..?
This is the same kind of response you get if a route isn't routable.

orangelight.title: Default book/manuscript thumbnail misses the content icon to navigate to the viewer

comments.body:
@kevinreiss the example record https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/9947826143506421 is a constituent record with host record the https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/9947826133506421. 
The host record manuscript exists in figgy so orangelight is able to create the thumbnail element and add the content (the icon ) in the CSS::before selector. 
In the case of the constituent record 9947826143506421 it does not exist in figgy. Orangelight cannot create a thumbnail  and the CSS::before selector will not add the content. 
https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/c017e0c6486aaaaf860a2cf0d6a1a9fd8d256974/app/javascript/orangelight/figgy_manifest_manager.js#L210-L213

princeton_ansible.title: nginx logs write to wrong error.log file

comments.body:
To replicate:

```
# ssh to a given machine
cd /var/log/nginx
ls -l
# observe error.log and error.log.1. With this error, error.log has size 0 and error.log.1 has a more recent timestamp than error.log
sudo rm error.log.1
sudo service nginx restart
# error.log should now have size > 0
sudo logrotate /etc/logrotate.d/nginx -f
# error.log.1 should now be created
# hit the site until error.log.1 timestamp refreshes to observe that the bug is still present
```

pulmap.title: Copy layer_geom_type_s to a new multivalued version of the field
Expect a new field for format facet, layer_geom_type_sm
Document how to reindex from figgy
Allow records to have two datatypes

comments.body:
Deployment strategy:
1. add copyfields to schema from `layer_geom_type_s` to `layer_geom_type_sm` and `layer_geom_type_tmi`. Also add copyfield from `layer_geom_type_sm` to `layer_geom_type_tmi`. (https://github.com/pulibrary/pulmap/pull/1075 and https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/pull/331)
2. reindex
3. (in prod) either dump partner records or get them reindexed
4. deploy pulmap changes that use the new field https://github.com/pulibrary/pulmap/pull/1076
5. deploy figgy changes the publish the new field https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/pull/5047
6. reindex again
